content.description:
A Buzzworm sat at the top of the route.

Climb the right-facing dihedral and crack to a shared anchor.

CAUTION: there is a massive block halfway up the pitch that we could not budge, but it appears to be detached. You can climb around it.
content.protection:
A standard rack including TCUs and nuts. Per

Guy H.

: bring up to a #3 C4.
content.location: This is the right-facing dihedral on the right side of the face. See the topo.

content.description: Start all the way down, with your left hand on the lowest part of the left arete, about 8 inches off the ground. Put your right hand on a small sidepull crimp. Climb the arete.
content.location: Park just past the Cache de la Poudre Visitor Center at a small, dirt pulloff on the right side of the road. Walk back down canyon 100 feet, cross the river where it is low, and go uphill to the boulder.

content.description: This ascends theleft arete of the boulder. Start at chest height on opposing sidepulls, and climb the arete.
content.location: Park just past the Cache de la Poudre Visitor Center at a small, dirt pulloff on the right side of the road. Walk back down canyon 100 feet, cross the river where it is low, and go uphill to the boulder.

content.description:
Skinny Dipping is a nice, long, sustained, face pitch.

Techy climbing on small positive edges leads up a steep, smooth face past an overhang. Continue up easier but sustained terrain passing a tough move off the first ledge.
content.location: This is the leftmost route on Picnic Rock.

content.description:
This has a roof crux followed by some thin slabbing.

Turn the roof, and follow a line of bolts to the shared anchor at the top of the wall.

A 70m rope gets you to the ground, a 60m will probably get you to the ledge at the start of the route. Knot the ends!
content.location:
This climbs the line of bolts starting at a roof midway between the

Less Lichen, More Lovin'

and

Chips and Beer

dihedrals. See the topo.

content.description:
Start in the dihedral, and follow a line of bolts to the shared anchor.

A 70m rope gets you to the ground, a 60m will probably get you to the ledge at the start of the route. Knot the ends!
content.location: This is the second route from the left on the face starting in a left-facing dihedral. See the topo.

content.description:
Chips and Beer has fun movement in the dihedral.

Turn the roof to get into the hanging dihedral, then follow bolts to the shared anchors.

A 70m rope gets you to the ground.
content.location: This is the fourth route from the left starting in a large, right-facing, hanging dihedral. See the topo.

content.description:
This is the easiest sport route, but it will still keep your attention.

Climb a series of intermittent cracks to a shared anchor. Continue straight up at the top where the crack veers right.
content.location:
This is ten feet right of the

Uninvited Guest

dihedral. It is halfway between

Uninvited Guest

and a large flake to the right. See the topo.
